name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Cristata Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I decided to stay here instead of Mohegan Sun which was $499/night. We thought the hotel was such a better deal for 1/2 the price. It is very close to the casino and the limo was great to dive us back and forth. Check in and check out was seamless. The room was a nice size. Unfortunatly the movie system was down on the tv. The fan in the bathroom was so loud it sounded like you were in an airplane ready to take off. Depite the noise, the fan didn't really work. After taking a shower the steam was still very thick. The continental breakfast was ok. Just enough to get you ready to hit the road or the casino. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice Alternative

likes.liked: — the price compared to Mohegan Sun's hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Best Western for a show at the casino. The limo service to the casino is great, very little wait time on either end of the trip. Very nice and knowledgeable drivers.
reviews.title: Great for the money
Best place to stay outside Mogegan Sun
reviews.text: Hotel is clean and perfect for a short stay, with the room having a sitting area, refrigerator and microwave. Nice continental breakfast in the morning. Nothing fancy, but perfect for a quick meal before hitting the road back home. The front desk staff was very nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely be back if we ever need to spend the night for a show or other event at the casino, and you can't beat the price!
reviews.title: Still great quality and value

likes.liked: — Limo Ride and location to Mohegan Sun

reviews.text: I like to stay at Mohegan Sun when I get a great deal, but when I can't the Best Western Cristata Inn in the best place to stay. I've stayed at a few other places in the area, but the Cristata is above all the rest. Not only for it's locality ( 1 mi. from MOhegan Sun), free limo service which runs on demand, but it's friendly and pleasant staff and clean rooms, which have a small fridge in case you want some snacks in the room. They also serve a great complimentary breakfast.. I have stayed here 4-5 times now and will continue in the future. Thanks Best Western!!!!
reviews.title: Uncalled For problems and Rudeness

likes.disliked: — Rude Staff made all problems even worse !!

reviews.text: Just returned from an overnight stay and have to admit that this was on the cleanest hotels that I have stayed in, in quite some time. The Mohegan Sun casino is so close you can almost walk there. Indoor pool and workout room also spotless. Continental breakfast a nice touch. I recommend this place.
reviews.title: Very Clean Place
Best Western Cristata-nice motel
reviews.text: My wife and I had a two night stay at the Best Western Cristata in Uncasville, CT, less than one mile from the Mohegan Sun Casino. We reserved online. No problems-check-in was fast and painless. They have an exercise room, indoor pool, and a nice complimentary continental breakfast.

reviews.title: Great Stay
reviews.text: The room was clean and spacious and the staff was friendly. The free limo rides to the casino were great also. A couple bucks tip if you choose.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Convenient to other attractions and a great value for the money, which is about 1/3 of the Mohegan rates. Will stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
I'll Be Back!!
reviews.text: My husband and I had a great stay at this hotel, Presidents Day Weekend, Mohegan Sun hotel was booked and this hotel is about 1 mile down the road.They have free limo service that will take you up and back, you just give them a call. The rooms are large, clean, and comfortable. The staff was friendly with a very nice continental breakfast. Reasonable rates. We would definitely stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has a limo which takes you to and from Mohegan Sun (5 minutes away). It has comfortable, clean, spacious studio rooms (kitchenette area) and a variety of breakfast foods in the lobby from 6:30 to 9:30 am (including waffles). Every employee is helpful and friendly. We did not use the fitness equipment or the indoor pool.
reviews.title: Stay here if you are going to Mohegan Sun!

reviews.text: I stayed one night in early September 2011. The hotel was clean, reasonably priced and had limo service the Mohegan Sun casino. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Good Choice Near Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel because of its location to Mohegan Sun and the price. Got a great deal with AAA card - $107 a night. Yippee! Our room was on the 4th floor. Was very clean and spacious - a suite with a king bed and a separate sitting area with a pull out couch, microwave, mini fridge, coffee maker and sink. The room looked like new...carpeting, appliances and bed spread/pillows - ALL very nice and clean. The fridge was quiet. We requested a room at the end of the hall away from the elevator. There was a free shuttle to the casino that ran from about check-in time til 4:00 am! AND...it was a stretch limo...a REAL stretch limo...not just a shuttle van you usually find at a hotel. The driver was a super nice retired gentleman who drove once a week for some extra cash. He was dressed up in a nice tuxedo too. He was very chatty, friendlt, and genuinely liked his job. The only downfalls,...and they were minor - it does serve the casino crowd and well, around 1:00 am, we were awakened by some loud gamblers who just returned from Mohegan. They found their room and we could hear them partying some thru the walls but lucky for us, they passed out soon thereafter. Also, if you aren't up ealry enough to take advantage of the complimentary breakfast which runs til 11:00 am (checkout time); forget it. They stop replenishing the eggs, muffins, etc probably around 9:30ish; so there were just scraps by the time we got there. No big deal, there is a greasy spoon almost directly across the street that a local told us about and they served breakfast all day - as do a couple places in the casino. Overall, this is a GREAT place to stay ay about 1/4 of what you would pay to stay at the casino.
reviews.title: We will be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in went smooth and front desk clerk Kim was very helpful in taking her time in explaining everything the hotel has to offer.We were pleasantly suprised by the complimentary Limosine service (not a van).And all the staff was very friendly throughout our two day stay.Limo driver Todd was very helpful in recommending good restaurants and bars in the Mohegan casino as well as making us feel comfortable. The concert was great and our stay couldn't have been any better.We can't wait to stay at the Cristata on our next trip to Mohegan.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay with great service

reviews.text: Nice, average hotel that gives you free limo (yes, actual Limos) rides to mohegan sun casino. Maybe 5 total minutes away. Room was clean, breakfast buffet was lacking, but free, and employees were nice.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel With Free Mohegan Sun Limo
Great Place
reviews.text: I went to the Cristata Inn from 5/20/04-5/23/04 for a long weekend at Mohegan Sun but did not want to pay the prices of Mohegan Sun. The Cristata Inn was perfect, the room was nice, the staff was great and the best part of it was the limo drive to and from Mohegan Sun. Although the limo's werent the newest, your in them for about a minute each way, and its great. You can go to and from as often as you want and the limo drivers were really nice. When you call them to pick you up from Mohegan Sun they are prompt and there within 5 minutes. I would definitly stay there again!

good place to stay. husband and I stayed for 2 nights ... april 18-19'04. bed was comfortable and had a smaller area with couch and desk, small fridge, microwave, and coffee maker and safe in room. complimentary breakfast was ample and also limo drive to and from mohegan sun till 2am in the morning was also complimentary. foxwood's 20 minutes away by car. front desk were nice and helpful. reasonable price, will stay again on next trip.
reviews.title: enjoyed stay
Fantastic!!
reviews.text: The best western in uncasville was PERFECT! They offer a limo ride to and from mohegan (its really like a 5 minute ride). The rooms which are all suites were great, they are like a regular hotel room with a living room. The service was really good, the limo driver was very nice. They picked us up from Mohegan Sun in about 2 minutes after calling. The pool was a bit small but hey it was completely empty and warm. The best was the price! We went on a sunday night for a day of gambling at mohegan and had a blast, the room was only 80 dollars! Compare that to Mohegan sun which is easily 175 dollars plus, you cant go wrong. This place deserves more business!

reviews.title: Short but great stay
reviews.text: My husband and I were on vacation and decided to swing past the Mohegan Sun for the first time. We stayed at the BWCristana Inn. We were very happy with our stay. The room was clean and spacious, the people at the desk were very friendly and helpful. There was a limo service, which we chose not to use, but the 2 big black limos were waiting for anyone who needed them!! Mohegan was a very short distance away. The breakfast was plentiful and someone was always cleaning up any spills and refilling anything that became low. I would highly recommend this motel and would stay there again.

reviews.title: Safe, Secure and Quiet Property
reviews.text: Returned several hours ago from a two night stay at the BW Cristata Inn. We were most impressed with this hotel's apparent regard for security. Cameras are wall mounted throughout the hotel (every floor, facing both ways down corridors) as well as around the parking lot. Several monitors are evident at the reception desk.

reviews.title: Found a Gem
reviews.text: Overall, this hotel was fine. The beds are firm and comfortable. All rooms are suites with a refrigerator, microwave and coffemaker ,as well as a small sink mounted in some cabinets (a mini kitchenette). The bathroom is well lit, large and very clean! There is a sitting area with a pull out sofa sleeper and a small desk and coffee table.

reviews.title: very impressed!!!
reviews.text: The complimentary continental breakfast was good--slightly more selections than are offered at nearby hotels--and available from 6am till 10 or 11 am on the weekend.

reviews.title: Great value for your money
reviews.text: There is a small gym on the property and a pool that was too cool and overly chlorinated to stay in for more than a few minutes-the only disappointing area of the hotel we noted.
We did not use the free Limo service as the casino is so close--the limo driver offered to drive us because the night was foggy but we declined. She was sweet and persisted--a nice touch!
reviews.title: Good Motel for casino gambling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Mohegan at the last minute. When I called this Best Western I was told the only non smoking rooms available were on the 3rd floor, which was a half smoking/ half non-smoking.floor and that there may be an odor of smoke in the room. I think I know why. Walking up and down the 3rd floor corridor I do not recall seeing any rooms that were specifically designated "non smoking" on any of the room doors. To be honest, there were no ash trays in our room (do hotels still supply them?) but the smoke odor was quite prevalent not just in our room but on the entire 3rd floor and in both elevators. You have to wonder if a smoking room becomes a non-smoking room depending on demand for one or the other (we were in Room 305).
reviews.title: Can half a hotel floor be non smoking?

reviews.text: Putting aside the smoke odor, the room was a decent sized for this category hotel, with a very comfortable bed and pillows and a good sized flat screen TV,. The A/C unit was one of the quietest we've experienced. The bathroom exhaust fan, however was industrial strength noisy, to the extent it woke my wife up in the morning. We had plenty of hot water. The room window is an opening type. We too occasionally heard heavy feet above our heads.
reviews.title: Great deal for Mohegan

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was well stocked with coffee, tea, bread, bagels, pastries, pre cooked omelets, etc. The limo and the drivers - Tom and George are assets to the hotel.
reviews.title: Near Mohegan Sun w/ Nice Amenities
This was a good choice
reviews.text: Were it not for the cigarette odor in the room and common areas I would've given the Christata 5 circles. If we stay here again it will not be on the 3rd floor.

Stayed here a couple of times and have always had an enjoyable stay. The staff is always very friendly and the rooms are sufficient for what is needed. This hotel is just around the corner from Mohegan sun,which makes it great after a late night. The room I was given recently had a lingering paint smell to it. It appears they had repainted the room recently and the smell was still present. The new(er) LG flat screen TVs are a great addition and provide a lot of channels.
reviews.title: Gamble, drink, day and night and no coffee the next morning!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very conveniently located to Mohegan Sun and the hotel provides a great shuttle service. You tell the front desk your ready to go and they send either a limo or van shuttle. It takes only 2 minutes to get from the hotel to the casino. Driver of the shuttle was great. Makes it very convenient and safe if you want to drink.
reviews.title: Loved the Shuttle Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a last minute rez so we had a smoking room which smelled. Other than that the room was clean and the beds were comfortable. Everything was in working order and the shower was refreshing with all the hot water you could ask for.
reviews.title: Dirty Rooms, Rude staff
Some Good, Some Bad
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel only because the hotels in the casino were booked. There was a list of other hotels that were available but we thought we'd go with a more established hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arriving late to the hotel, in the early morning hours because our flight was delayed, we went to our room only to realize the whole floor reaked of smoke and other dirty smells. The rooms were disgusting. We had specifically asked for non-smoking but they said sometimes there are mistakes. What really happened is that they gave our room to other people, because they assumed we were not coming.
reviews.title: Back to Cristata

reviews.text: The front desk was rude when I asked to talk to management and said that there was nothing we could do. They wouldnt give our money back to go to another hotel. It was ridiculous... especially since we paid close to $500 for 2 nights!
reviews.title: A real gem!

likes.disliked: — A little difficult to find off the highway

reviews.title: Great location - one concern
reviews.text: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Best Western Cristata Inn. The hotel's location was perfect for doing various things in Connecticut. From there we (1) spent an evening with a friend near Norwich (2) drove to the ferry in New London and spent a day at Block Island (3) spent a day in Mystic and an evening in Stonington (4) went to Mohegan Sun two different times, and (5) visited Gillette Castle State Park Everything was a short drive from the hotel. Our room was a nonsmoking king suite - it was fairly priced - clean - comfortable - available when we arrived early. The bed was acceptable and the room looked just like we expected it to look from the Best Western website. The basic breakfast (toast, cereal, sweet rolls, fruit) was plenty for us. There was, though, just one concern. There was no insulation around the door to the room. At night, we could see light coming in from the hallway around the doorframe and all noise in the hallway (even low level conversations) were easily heard. This could be a problem to a light sleeper. Otherwise, we had a great time at the Best Western Cristata Inn.

reviews.title: Decent Hotel - Not really Suites though - Perfect for budget conscience people
reviews.text: The limo rides are "free" but the drivers expect decent size tips. I wasn't happy with either of the drivers. One kept telling me how poor he was and that he has a garbage job that pays nothing and customers are cheap.... I never ask, I found it odd and uncomfortable. This is no better then some begging for money on the street.

On the first night when I was dropped off at the casino I told the driver (who had told me he was working all night) that i realized I didn't have change and I would catch him on the way back. He then told me he would wait while i got change. I was lucky he got a call and had to leave because I was about to say something not so nice.... I ended up taking a cab back for $5.00 including tip (it was shared though). You can actually walk from the hotel if you enjoy walking it about a half mile to the resort.
reviews.title: Short Limo ride and reasonable rate
Loved Our Stay at the Best Western Cristata Inn
reviews.text: The hotel itself is ok, they don't really have suites like they say but they are honest if you look at the virtual tour and there website. Not sure why they call it suites but they are one room, no door and only one TV.

reviews.title: Best Value
reviews.text: The hotel was clean and the service was excellent. We paid abouth 1/2 of what we paid the year before staying at the Mohegan Sun hotel. The under five minute limo ride to Mohegan was prompt and comfortable. Would stay there again, Esp stay there if you want to save a few bucks.

reviews.title: Nice hotel
reviews.text: The rooms have sitting areas where you can sit, watch TV, and have a drink. There is a mini fridge and sink. There's a desk to do some work (if needed). Tne room also has an ironing table, iron, and safe.
Highly recommended!!
reviews.title: I love this hotel!
Honest value
reviews.text: Very nice hotel. Loved the unlimited limo rides, fresh fruit at desk. Very clean. Personnel were nice and accomodating. Close to Mohegan sun. It was a short trip but would use this hotel again. Missed breakfast-sigh!

Checked in on a Friday at 4 and our room was ready - no waiting. I requested the top floor and was very happy to see it honored. I was pleasantly surprised when I walked into the room.....very nice indeed! There was a nice sitting area, and the beds were very comfortable. I especially liked the fact that there were 4 pillows on each queen bed! I love a lot of pillows when I sleep. There is a nice desk if using a laptop, and the kitchen area has a small sink, microwave and refrigerator.
reviews.title: Very nice place.....will definitely return!

reviews.text: The front desk staff were very nice and helpful. In particular, I loved the limo ride to/from the casino! Did not have to wait at all. Left the casino around midnight, and the limo was already there waiting for us! It was great....And the breakfast was decent as well. It was nice just going downstairs for coffee and a waffle!
reviews.title: Nice place to stay :) and its so affordable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'll definitely stay here again.....
reviews.title: Disgusting stench of smoke throughout hotel. Terrible service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this place was so near Mohegun sun.The limo service was so GOOD ideal to people traveling with friends.Staffs are friendly. Nice place to go to hit Mohegan Sun Casino.
reviews.title: A more affordable alternative close to the Sun

reviews.text: We checked in on Saturday afternoon and there was literally a 30 minute line at the front desk with only 2 clerks working. Once we finally checked in, we got off the elevator on our floor to an overwhelming and vile stench of cigarette smoke that permeated the entire floor. I am not particularly sensitive to odor issues but the room itself was absolutely uninhabitable. The front desk refused to switch us to a non-smoking floor or room. They offered to send an "ionizer" to our room and said this was the best they would do. An ionizer? Seriously? We could not breathe! Apparently, although we had selected non-smoking rooms when reserved online, the confirmation changed our reservation to smoking without notification. We told them that this amounted to consumer fraud, however, they showed zero interest in helping us or accommodating us in any way. We came downstairs to talk with the manager, who appeared to be about 19 years old, and offered no help at all. I have never been treated this poorly by any hotel in America. If you are looking for an inexpensive room near the Sun, do not stay at this tragic establishment. We ended up checking out immediately and we are disputing the charges. Do not stay here. You've been warned.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Southeastern Connecticut

reviews.text: My 2 friends & I stayed here back in march. We were headed to Mohegan to see bon Jovi & mohegan's hotel was unbelievable expensive so we chose the cristata inn. While I wouldn't call this place really cheap, it was worth the money. The front desk staff seemed a little overwhelmed but that could have been because there was a line. The 2 women we dealt with were disorganized & a bit snobby but what did we care, we were there to see Bon Jovi!!!! The room was awesome!! It was huge, lots of room for us ladies to get ready. We never made it to the indoor pool, so I can't comment on that. However, I will comment on how awesome the limo driver & limo ride was. We only waited for like 10 minutes & the casino was literally right around the corner. Be sure if you have to be at the casino for a certain time, that you leave early enough because it may take you up to 15-20 minutes to get to the casino depending on how long the limo line is. There was quite a line behind us. The limo drivers were very friendly and sociable. They seem to truly enjoy their job. Breakfast was medocre. There was plenty of tables & chairs in the breakfast area. Food was just ok. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. And I know my friends feel the same. You won't be sorry for booking a room at the cristata!!
reviews.title: Everyone would love this place!!

reviews.text: Stayed there while seeing a concert at the casino. Staff was very pleasant, helpful, personable, intuitive both when I made reservations over the phone and on our arrival.
reviews.title: Good value & service

reviews.text: Room was roomy, good amenities, clean & orderly. Comfortable bed. Pool clean & well maintained. Breakfast simple but effective with decent selection. Shuttle to the casino was a stretch limo, efficient, excellent service and extremely convenient. Good value for what we paid, well worth another stay.
reviews.title: A Perfectly Fine Hotel

reviews.text: Four of us girls went to Mohegan Sun for a concert and chose this hotel for our base.It is located on rt.32 N , right off the highway,with gas,liquor store,nd chinese food right nearby.The casino is a five minute ride from this hotel.We used the limousine service,which is provided by the hotel for guests,and included in your room rate.The driver,George was very nice,and promptly came to pick us up after a great night at Mohegan.We had the car to ourselves each time and it was enjoyable.The room was a jr.suite,with 2 queen beds,and we all like the lyaout,and having an extra room to hang out in.There is a pull out sofa,which I chose to sleep on,which was marginally comfortable,for 1 night.I cannot recommend it for a longer stay,though.There was a small
reviews.title: The BW will always be my first choice when visiting the casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: sink,,microwave and refridgerator.Vending machines and ice were at the end of the hall on the 3rd floor.No issues with the elevators.The lobby is fine,and the staff were really nice to deal with.Our room was pretty close to the elevators,but we heard no noise.It was quiet there at night as well.We didn't use the pool.The room was clean and they gave us extra blankets when we requested them.Separte mirror and sink area,,which was good for 4 girls getting ready for a night out.The bathrrom ws a separate little room,with tub ,toilet and shower.We all liked it and would stay there again.It was clean and we were pleased! Great Job,BW !!
reviews.title: "Not as bad as the people on there write"

aka: Best Western Plus Cristata Hotel Uncasville
